alert.note: Alert for Northern Penobscot; Southeast Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 27 at 3:28PM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...An area of heavy snow showers will affect southeastern Aroostook and north central Penobscot Counties... At 327 PM EST...An area of heavy snow showers was along a line extending from near Hodgdon to Katahdin Woods and Waters National Monument...and moving southeast AT 10 MPH. Maine DOT cameras show rapidly changing road conditions between Sherman and Houlton. Locations impacted include... Houlton, Patten, Hodgdon, Sherman, Island Falls, Amity, Cary Plantation, southern Katahdin Woods and Waters National Monument, Sherman Station, Linneus, Oakfield, New Limerick, Stacyville, Crystal, Cary, Dyer Brook, Hersey, Forkstown, North Amity and Benedicta. This includes the following highways... Interstate 95 between mile markers 260 and 281, and between mile markers 299 and 304. US Highway 1 between North Amity and Houlton. State Highway 11 between Stacyville and Patten. * Winds in excess of 25 mph are possible with this area of heavy snow showers. * Visibilities will drop quickly to less than a quarter mile in this area of heavy snow showers. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time when traveling.
